item.title: How R and Python Talk to Each Other
item.description: How R and Python Talk to Each Other Believe it or not, R and Python can talk to each other! This can be accomplished with the R package reticulate. For example: # Using R library(reticulate) # Load the `reticulate` package str1 = "This is how R" # Using Python str2 = "and python talk to each other." print(r.str1, str2) ## This is how R and python talk to each other.

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Joyce Wang (yw9497) 0. Introduction As a Biology major, I decided to use the Wisconsin Brest Cancer Dataset obtained from: https://www.kaggle.com/uciml/breast-cancer-wisconsin-data. Since I could not find a dataset to join with this one, I will separate it into 2 datasets. This dataset contains 32 measurements of breast cancer samples from 569 patients. id represents the unique IDs of all the samples. diagnosis classifies the tumors as either benign (B) or malignant (M).

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Joyce Wang (yw9497) 0. Introduction As a Biology major, I decided to use the Full Leaf Shape Data Set from the DAGG package. This dataset contains 9 measurements from 286 leaf samples in Australia: 1. bladelen: leaf length in mm 2. petiole: length of the petiole (the stalk that attaches the leaf blade to the stem) in mm 3. bladewid: leaf width in mm 4.
